text: it looks pretty comical but actually
there's a serious story behind this and
these same set of researchers found out
that flipper tags that they were using
to study penguins were causing the
Penguins harm so they started using
these little transponders that were put
under their skin but they needed to get
close to the Penguins in order to read
radio data from those little tags and to
be able to monitor each of the
individuals in these really important
species so they started using these
Rovers and the only way they could get
close to this very very shy species of
emperor penguin without them running
away and becoming very very stressed was
to disguise one of those Rovers as a
penguin chick and why would they get
nervous I mean lots of animals you could
put anything next to them and they
wouldn't pay any attention well this is
about humans not approaching those
penguins so they actually these
researchers wanted to know what effect
they were having on the species that
they were studying so they started
looking at the heart rate of king
penguins they're different species when
they approached them to try to get this
radio data off their tag as it's like
scanning an identity on your pet and
they found their heart rates really
increased and so they used the rover to
approach the Penguins without the humans
having to get nearby and they found that
their heart rate didn't increase as much
so it's stressing them much less and
they say that's a more ethical way to
gather the data that they want to be
able to study and conserve this species
